definitions.definition: The act of doing that which begins anything; commencement of an action, state, or space of time; entrance into being or upon a course; the first act, effort, or state of a succession of acts or states.
That which is begun; a rudiment or element.
That which begins or originates something; the source or first cause.
definitions.example: What was the beginning of the dispute?

definitions.definition: The initial portion of some extended thing.
definitions.example: That house is at the beginning of the street.

definitions.definition: To start, to initiate or take the first step into something.
definitions.example: I began playing the piano at the age of five.   Now that everyone is here, we should begin the presentation.

definitions.definition: To be in the first stage of some situation
definitions.example: The program begins at 9 o'clock on the dot.    I rushed to get to class on time, but the lesson had already begun.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to the first portion of some extended thing.
definitions.example: in the beginning paragraph of the chapter
